lines: A wild driver cuts you off on the highway.

You cut him off and slam on the brakes. This makes him go berserk. He pulls up alongside your car and shakes his fist at you. The man in the car is thin and wiry and looks like he hasn't shaved in days. He has a VERY crazy look in his eyes.
#GIVE HIM THE FINGER AND DRIVE AWAY

He chases after you and begins trying to push your car off the road. You have gotten yourself entangled with someone who is emotionally disturbed. The car you are driving is now dented and scraped on the passenger side.

You approach a concrete overpass. The maniac bumps you toward it. You notice that he is waving a gun out the window. If you stop he will probably try to shoot you. If you try to get away, he will force you into the bridge abutment. What
He pulls off onto the shoulder next to you and starts shouting. He points the gun toward the car, pulls the trigger and you hear a loud CRACK!

Glass shatters everywhere. It's in your hair and eyes. Two more shots follow as he blows out your tire. He looks you right in the eye, reaches in the window and pulls the sleeve of your blouse. He sneers, "Bitch."
It looks as if he might try to kill you, but then he laughs and runs back to his car. He drives away. As you see his car disappear into the distance, you jot down the license number.
The car was stolen. They have no other clues.
It is only a toy gun. The man laughs wildly, gets back on the road and begins driving in the opposite direction. The moral of the story: It does not pay to mess with crazy people.

No chance. He bumps you off the road. The scream of the tires skidding across the highway is interrupted by a resounding explosion and the sounds of shattering glass. As you hit the concrete overpass, the car explodes and burns. You are
burned to death. This game is over.
This person is a crazy man. He had a gun and would have tried to kill you if you had messed with him. You were smart to hold your temper, even though you would have liked to run him off the road.
You chase him and begin to weave in and out of traffic. The two of you are driving very dangerously.
#KEEP GOING UNTIL YOU GET THE BASTARD
A wise choice. Innocent people could have gotten hurt by the way you were driving.

The guy in the other car swerves in front of a car driven by an elderly woman. You pull alongside him, cursing and threatening him. The elderly woman realizes what is happening and becomes frightened. She steps on the brake a bit too
hard and slides off the road. She hits her head on the steering wheel and passes out.
#GO BACK AND TRY TO GET ASSISTANCE FOR HER
#KEEP GOING AFTER THE GUY IN THE CAR
Fortunately, she has just been shaken up.
You behaved in a very irresponsible way, without regard for the health and safety of others. You should be ashamed of yourself for showing such poor judgment.

You are spotted by the police and are arrested for reckless driving. In addition, the elderly woman, whom you caused to slide off the road, sues you for damages. You lose your license and $2000 in Resources.
Is hurting an elderly woman what it takes to get you to think sensibly? You might have killed her, you know. You'll never find out if she regained consciousness. Have a pleasant night's sleep.

Anyone who would choose this response pattern is potentially very dangerous. In this frame of mind you could calmly and easily drive him off the road and into a concrete divider, killing him. Fortunately, a state trooper has seen the
incident and pulls up alongside you.
You can't go through with your plan without getting caught, so for now you abandon it.
